meanings.definition: The ability to perform multiple tasks simultaneously.
meanings.sent1: Multitasking can help you get more things done at the same time.
meanings.sent2: I admire her multitasking skills as she can cook, clean, and talk on the phone all at once.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle cooking, cleaning, and answering the phone at the same time is like a multitasking circus act!
meanings.sent4: Her brain is like a multitasking machine, effortlessly handling various tasks at once.
meanings.sent5: The art of multitasking is like conducting a symphony of tasks, each playing its part in harmony.

meanings.definition: The act of switching between tasks quickly and efficiently.
meanings.sent1: His multitasking involves smoothly transitioning from one task to another without any delay.
meanings.sent2: In a busy office, multitasking is essential to keep up with the demands of the job.
meanings.sent3: Watching him multitask between answering emails and attending meetings is like witnessing a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent4: She approached her work with the precision of a multitasking ninja, swiftly moving from task to task.
meanings.sent5: The art of multitasking is like a skilled juggler, effortlessly tossing tasks in the air and catching them with ease.
